poem:
Title: "The Furnace of Disparity"

Heat, the canny midwife, hurries life,
In low-built homes where poverty is rife.
Black, Hispanic mothers in its glare,
Bearing early gifts in unjust air. 
Trip the thermostat - there's harm in heat,
A future scorched, and bitter-sweet.
Earth faces fever, yet we shun the cost,
In every child born early, hope is lost.
